name: Raccoon
overview: Raccoons are known for their black mask covering their eyes with their light and dark strips alternating on its tail. An adult raccoon averages length from 24 to 38 inches in length and 14 to 23 lbs in weight. The young are called kits.
habitat: Originally, they lived in the tropics along riverbanks. Over a period of time, they have adapted to new territories and food diets. Before, they lived in trees or burrows to hunt for frogs and crustaceans away from coyotes and foxes. However, through immigration, their homes vary depending on their habitat and food supply. These home vary from mountain terrains to large cities. Their common food are fruits, berries, nuts, insect, rodents etc. But in urban areas, they eat food from the garbage.
